Article Title: Omar Abdullah’s minister asks J&K MP to resign for planning protest
Article Text:
File photo: J&K CM Omar Abdullah (Picture credit: PTI)

SRINAGAR: A day after National Conference (NC) MP from Srinagar, Aga Ruhullah Mehdi, said he would stage a protest outside J&K CM Omar Abdullah ’s residence over government’s failure to rationalise reservation policy, the party on Friday accused him of acting at the behest of central govt and asked him to resign if he remained unwilling to align with NC’s policies.“He (Mehdi) has friends in New Delhi and is acting on their behalf. This is New Delhi’s doing. Instead of blaming the J&K govt, he should ask his friends in New Delhi to ensure that the file on rationalisation of reservations, cleared by the J&K govt and forwarded by it to the lieutenant governor for approval, is still in LG’s office. Let him get it cleared from there,” said minister for jal shakti, forest and tribal affairs Javed Ahmad Rana.“Instead of protesting outside the LG’s residence or office, he is planning to protest against the popular govt that has already decided the matter. This is not morally correct,” Rana said. “We have done our job. It is now for the LG to act on it.”He also took a swipe at Mehdi, saying that many people who spend time in Delhi start moving in influential circles and then begin to “punch above their weight”.He said, “The Srinagar MP has caught the same infection. He believes he has become bigger than he is, but our party’s long experience shows that Delhi infection does not work in Jammu and Kashmir .”
Article Summary: National Conference (NC) MP from Srinagar, Aga Ruhullah Mehdi, said he would stage a protest outside J&K CM Omar Abdullah ’s residence. The party on Friday accused him of acting at the behest of central govt and asked him to resign.

Article Title: Vajpayee: The statesman who taught India to dream big
Article Text: Students create a large charcoal portrait of former PM Vajpayee on his birth anniversary in Moradabad, Thursday
Article Summary: Students create a large charcoal portrait of former PM Vajpayee on his birth anniversary in Moradabad, India. Students create a big portrait of the former PM on his birthday anniversary in India. The portrait is called 'Vajpayee' and is made up of charcoal, ink and graphite.

Article Title: Kerala gets its first BJP mayor
Article Text:
VV Rajesh

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: BJP has won its first mayoral election in Kerala, with its state secretary V V Rajesh being elected to the top post of Thiruvananthapuram municipal corporation in polls held for mayors and deputy mayors in six civic bodies in the state on Friday.Rajesh, an advocate, has been active in politics for more than two decades, serving in organizational roles, including as BJP Thiruvananthapuram district president. This is his second term as a councillor. He secured 51 votes, including the crucial backing from independent councillor Pattoor Radhakrishnan, giving NDA a simple majority in the 101-member corporation.This is the first time NDA will be governing a city corporation in Kerala. Women mayors were elected in three corporations - Kochi, Thrissur and Kannur. These posts were reserved for women.Meanwhile, Kollam corporation got its first UDF mayor in A K Hafees after the Congress-led front's historic win.
Article Summary: V V Rajesh, an advocate, has been active in politics for more than two decades. He secured 51 votes, including the crucial backing from independent councillor Pattoor Radhakrishnan. Women mayors were elected in three corporations - Kochi, Thrissur and Kannur.
